alert.note: Alert for Harney County; Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:44PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harney and northwestern Malheur Counties through 630 PM MDT/530 PM PDT/... At 544 PM MDT/444 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cottonwood Creek Reservoir, or 44 miles northeast of Burns, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beulah around 550 PM MDT. Beulah Reservoir and Castle Rock around 600 PM MDT. Westfall Butte around 610 PM MDT. Brushy Hollow around 620 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Beulah Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
